page.title: 16Trade: Shopping
page.content: Modern trends are for large stores with parking facilities. Examples in the D-Block are Agri-Electrics and MFI.Local shops for everyday needs are in 2 main areas:1.The Parade,Blacon _ two blocks of post-war shops with a modern bank. 2.The Close,Blacon _ a 1960s pedestrian precinct. Noel Baker, owner of The Close butchers won 1st prize for British beef sausage in 1985. He described a typical working day:After a bacon breakfast,he arrives at work at 08 00.(earlier Fri. & Sat.) The shop is open for business whilst the window is dressed by 4 butchers,it takes 1-2 hr. Sausages made,cooked meats prepared, they phone hotels and canteens,then make up their orders. Lunch is from 13 00 - 14 00.Afterwards they serve, accept deliveries and from 4 p.m empty the windows, clean trays and cash up ready to close at 17 30.
